alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 12:56AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Choctaw. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a slow moving band of showers producing very heavy rainfall across portions of central and northern Choctaw County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Butler, Lisman, Pennington, Little Walker, Mount Sterling, Robjohn, Jachin, Lavaca, Cromwell, Mollie, Pelham, Tompkinsville, Naheola, Edna, Ararat, Halsell and Lou.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
